results.title: We believe in it...We know it's true
results.brief_description: This program, narrated by Ian Dunlop, was filmed in 1982 at Yirrkala on the Gove Peninsula in the Northern Territory. Yirrkala was established as a Methodist mission in 1935, but today is an Aboriginal township. This is a film about the importance of cultural continuity in this Aboriginal community. It records funeral ceremonies, traditional dances and songs. It also examines the special educational programs to inform white Territorians about the culture of their Aboriginal neighbours and to educate Aboriginal children in their own language at Yirrkala school.
results.title_for_label: We believe in it…We know it’s true

results.title: The Civil War. Episode 9, 1865--the better angels of our nature
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, Ric Burns, Florentine Films and WETA-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Civil War”.
At Lee’s surrender, church bells peal throughout the North. The South is in ruin and despair. Unable to accept that the war is over, the actor John Wilkes Booth steals into a Washington theatre and puts a bullet into the brain of Abraham Lincoln. The nation’s grief knows no bounds; even Southerners are appalled, and the isolated fighting stutters to a halt. It is time to rebuild: “to listen”, as Lincoln implored four years before, “to the better angels of our nature”. The episode recounts the fates of the many players, great and small in the enormous drama which redefined the meaning of freedom in America.

results.title: Working from home
results.brief_description: Outlines the practical steps involved in launching and running your own home business. You will receive vital tips on how to avoid common pitfalls, and how to reach your potential faster. Topics covered include: why home business is booming, the benefits and disadvantages, what type of business can be run from home, launching your home business, managing your business - and yourself, what happens if you are sick, and much more. Presented by Charles Weyman.

results.title: Lost in the bush
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds, E.J. Perry and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A film based on an actual incident. In 1864 three young children belonging to a small squatting family wandered far from home and found themselves lost in the Australian outback. The film concentrates on the children’s struggle to survive in the bush and on the search mounted by their family to find them. Based on the account of the search written by Les Blake in the 1860’s. Cast includes Gabrielle Bulle, Colin Freckleton, Richard McClelland.

results.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Global report”.
This compilation tape consists of two programs. 1. “Emergency situation in Africa” illustrates the related problems of farming, malnutrition, disease and rural-urban migration in Africa. (22 mins.) 2. “Valley of hope” shows some of the benefits of having a health care worker in a developing country by comparing infant survival in two villages in Colombia; one which has a health care worker and one which doesn’t (30 mins.) “Valley of hope” is also available as an individual title.

results.title: Elements organised: the periodic table
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, Tony Jolly, BBC and Open University
results.brief_description: A series of excellent demonstrations, with graphics, showing how the great variety in the behaviour of the elements can be organised into a systematic structure, the Periodic Table. Please note that there is some background noise on the tape. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Mind hidden and divided
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How do events and experiences in the subconscious affect our moods, actions and health? In this program, Philip Zimbardo explores the power of the subconscious to control pain and to alter consciousness following suggestions made under hypnosis. He also examines cases where the subconscious spills over into consciousness and produces personality disorders such as multiple personalities.

results.title: Remembering and forgetting
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
The average human brain can store approximately 100 trillion bits of information as memory. Memory is essential for human survival. It is a complex psychological process influenced by many factors. In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines how memory works, where in the brain memory is located, the difference between long and short term memory and the effect on memory when brain cells are damaged.
results.description:

results.title: Child's play
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Developing child”.
With the ability to walk, the child reaches a major milestone along the road to adulthood. One day they will leave their family’s care and face the world alone. The toddler asserts their new sense of independence. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
